info.title: Inventory
info.description:
INVENTORY

Use the Inventory API to retrieve the inventory levels of requested products, refresh and adjust current stock levels at fulfillment locations, and tag segmented inventory for different channels. When using tags for inventory segmentation, inventory records are separated into categories to identify which portions of its total quantity are intended for different channels, customer groups, fulfillment methods, or other needs. This allows for setting a percentage of the quantity that would be available for each category and setting discrete units at the location level as available for each category. For example, tags could define how much of each inventory record is set aside for a certain sales channel: the Kibo storefront, Walmart, or Amazon. The percentages of the inventory allotted for each channel would add up to 100% - the Kibo storefront could have 80% of the inventory, Amazon 10%, and Walmart 10%. For more information, see the Inventory guides.

Use the Inventory, Inventory Allocation, and Modify Inventory resources to retrieve and update inventory levels.

Use the Inventory Job resource to retrieve information about your pending inventory update processing jobs.

Use the Inventory Tag and Tag Category resources to segment your inventory records.

post.description: Update the designated bin

Creates entirely new export configurations for both FTP and S3 settings. This call allows you to specify all the values for the Export Settings object, such as file type and specific location groups or sites (which cannot be edited through FTP- or S3-specific endpoints). This is the initial setup request required to configure inventory export.
Run Export Settings Job

Updates the entire Export Settings object, including FTP and S3 configurations as well as file type and specific location groups or sites (which cannot be edited through FTP- or S3-specific endpoints).

delete.description: Deletes the entire Export Settings object, including any FTP or S3 configurations within it.

post.description: Creates new FTP settings and adds them to an existing Export Settings object, which may be useful if you want the export to go to a new endpoint instead of the one originally set up (or if the export needs to go to multiple endpoints). This call will not function unless you have performed the initial Create Export Settings request first.
Updates the FTP settings within an existing Export Settings object.

delete.description: Deletes the specified FTP settings object. Not specifying the FTP Name/ID will delete all FTP settings within the Export Settings. This will not delete the entire Export Settings object.

post.description: Creates new S3 settings and adds them to an existing Export Settings object, which may be useful if you want the export to go to a new endpoint instead of the one originally set up (or if the export needs to go to multiple endpoints). This call will not function unless you have performed the initial Create Export Settings request first.

Updates the S3 settings within an existing Export Settings object. Note that you cannot update location groups or sites with this request - you must use the full Update Export Settings request instead.

delete.description: Deletes the specified S3 settings object. Not specifying the S3 Name/ID will delete all S3 settings within the Export Settings. This will not delete the entire Export Settings object.

post.description: Creates new GSC settings and adds them to an existing Export Settings object, which may be useful if you want the export to go to a new endpoint instead of the one originally set up (or if the export needs to go to multiple endpoints). This call will not function unless you have performed the initial Create Export Settings request first.
Updates the GCS settings within an existing Export Settings object.

delete.description: Deletes the specified GCS settings object. Not specifying exportSettingsGCSID deletes ALL GCS settings for the specified export settings.

post.description: Invalidate Cache
Allocates inventory based on the given request

As the Refresh Inventory call does not clear allocated inventory, you can use this Deallocate Inventory call if you have items stuck in "Allocated" status. This requires details about the shipment and which specific line items need to be deallocated. For examples on how to find shipments with allocated inventory and perform a deallocation on them, see the Inventory API guide.
Fulfills inventory based on the given request
Transitions a cart allocation into a normal order/shipment allocation
Create a bin
Search bins for a inventory by bin name or any product identifier
Loads bin inventory for designated bins
Update the designated bins
Setting the blockAssignment flag to true for the product based on the given request

post.description: Queries for specified inventory at given location. To call the version of this API with RIS (real-time inventory service) data, use the /commerce/realtime-inventory/v5/inventory endpoint instead.
Aggregates inventory.

get.description: Get the specified inventory upload job. Once an inventory file has been uploaded for processing, use this call to find the correct job ID as well as the status of the job. Once the job has been found, continue calling the API to monitor the status of the inventory upload and see when the job has been successfully uploaded, as well as the number of items uploaded.

parameters.name: locationCode
parameters.description: Tenant specified unique Identifier of the owning location

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return, defaults to 100 for most

parameters.name: types
parameters.description: Type of the Job Queue Request

parameters.name: originalFilename
parameters.description: The full name of the file that was picked up at the secure droppoint server before being split up by location.

post.description: Save Location

Sets the inventory count for products at a particular location. These requests are placed into a queue of jobs that are processed one at a time. Due to this, the best practice is to submit fewer requests with more items per call, rather than numerous requests with a small number of items each. Unlike the Adjust API that only accepts a maximum of 1000 items per call, this Refresh API can accept up to 12000 items. However, Kibo recommends batches of 3000 items.

Adjusts the inventory count for a product at a location. It is different from Inventory Refresh because rather than stating the total quantity of the product, this adjustment specifies the amount of change in the form of increments and decrements (+/-). Increments do not require a + sign and may be sent as a simple integer, but decrements must include the sign. For example, there would be a -2 quantity for an item if there were two fewer than in the previous count, a 2 quantity if there were two more, and a 0 quantity if there were no change.
These requests are placed into a queue of jobs that are processed one at a time. Due to this, the best practice is to submit fewer requests with more items per call, rather than numerous requests with a small number of items each. However, unlike the Refresh API that accepts a maximum of 12000 items per call, this Adjust API only accepts up to 1000 items. If you exceed that limit, a Bad Request error will be returned.
Delete Inventory
Deletes future inventory.
Deletes multiple inventory items.
Retrieves the information for a specific order item

fulfills.description: Total number of fulfillments. Should never be greater than 1.

onhand.description: Expected change in the actual onhand inventory value when this future inventory record is released.

available.description: Expected change in the actual available inventory value when this future inventory record is released.

allocated.description: Expected change in the actual allocated inventory value when this future inventory record is released.

pending.description: Number of new expected pending items that would be created by releasing this future inventory record assuming no actual inventory is available

type.description: Type of future inventory update: REFRESH or ADJUST.

deliveryDate.description: Date at which this inventory will become available. Expected format '2020-09-28T12:00:00-0500'

isDefault.description: Whether or not this tag is the default tag for its category.

percent.description: Percentage of available inventory this tag will get when the percentage update is performed. Must be between 0 and 100 (inclusive).

updated.description: Date this tag was last updated

InventoryTagQuantity.title: Tag quantity response
InventoryTagQuantity.description: Response object for a tag quantity

onHand.description: The quantity the the location has in its possession for this tag

available.description: The quantity the location has that are available for purchase for this tag

allocated.description: The quantity the location has that are already allocated for this tag

pending.description: The quantity the location has that are pending for this tag

CreateExportSettingsRequest.description: Request to create a new Export Settings

ExportInventoryRequest.description: Request to run an inventory export

UpdateExportSettingsRequest.description: Request to update an existing Export Settings

CreateExportSettingsFTPRequest.description: Request to create a new Export Settings FTP

UpdateExportSettingsFTPRequest.description: Request to update an existing Export Settings FTP

CreateExportSettingsS3Request.description: Request to create a new Export Settings S3

UpdateExportSettingsS3Request.description: Request to update an existing Export Settings S3

CreateExportSettingsGCSRequest.description: Request body for creating Export Settings GCS

UpdateExportSettingsGCSRequest.description: Request body for updating Export Settings GCS

ShipmentInventoryAllocationRequest.description: Request to future and current inventory allocations of item

UpdateTenantSiloConfigRequest.description: Request to create tenant silo config

TagCategory.description: Request create or modify Tag Categories

InvalidateCacheRequest.description: Request to invalidate a specific cache entry by its key

TransitionCartRequest.description: Request needed for transitioning cart allocations to order/shipment allocations

CreateBinRequest.description: Request to create a new bin

BlockAssignmentRequest.description: Request to block assignment on the product

OrderItemInformationRequest.description: Request to retrieve order item information

bearerAuth.description: JWT Authorization header using the Bearer scheme.
